DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Graft Infusion Procedure Begin Time Unit of Measure
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The unit of measure that represents the time as standard time or daylight savings time that the hematopoietic cell graft infusion procedure began.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Graft Infusion Procedure Begin
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)._Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion._Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Infusion Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
